  • Experience in creating original videos
  • Experience in YouTube and Social Media marketing with video
  • Ability to appear on camera
  • Comfortable directing others and conducting interviews on camera
  • Deep understanding of all aspects of production — shooting, editing, lighting, audio, art directing, styling and set decorating
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
  • Self-starter with high level of initiative
  • Preferred: Experience in email marketing and working with SaaS
  • This position is full time (40 hours per week)

What we offer

    • Competitive salary
    • Amazing team
    • Remote-first culture with half of the team in Vilnius, Lithuania and the other half working remotely from all over the world
    • Office or remote – you get to choose every day
    • Free healthy lunches, snacks and coffee in the Vilnius office
    • Company-paid retreats that we call workations. The entire team gathers twice a year in an exotic location to work, learn and have fun together for a week

    • MacBook Pro and other tools that you will need

      Instead, we offer a better way to apply:

      1. Sign up for a free MailerLite account

      Before you send the email, you will need your new account to be approved. In the approval form, you will be asked how you collect subscribers and what type of content you plan to send. Just write "Job application."

      • Examples of the videos that you're most proud of
      • Companies you've worked for

UX/UI Designer

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 80 people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for a UX/UI Designer who wants to help us make ecommerce easier for everyone.
We want you to join one of our product engineering teams and help us build a product our customers love. The product engineering team at TaxJar is solving complex problems on a daily basis, supporting our growing customer base and creating new solutions in a complex domain. We deal with large datasets, complex frequently-changing sales tax rules, and automating complex processes for thousands of business customers.
*This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US.

As a UX/UI Designer at TaxJar you will:

  • Be responsible for crafting modern, user-optimized experiences that help support and improve the efficiency of one of the biggest and fastest growing teams inside TaxJar
  • Work closely with our internal AutoFile Team and dedicated engineering teams
  • Take ownership of and improve the experience for our internal AutoFile tools and the repetitive nature of filings, issue management, and communication with customers
  • Lead the complete product development cycle through planning, design, testing, and eventually production release

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2-6 years UX/Design experience in SaaS or other business applications
  • Strong visual design, product design, usability, and communication skills
  • Demonstrable experience in product design at one or more successful SaaS companies
  • Someone who gets excited to jump on Zoom with stakeholders on other teams to get their insight
  • Ability to create complex user flows detailing user journeys
  • Ability to rapidly prototype to test and validate the team's design efforts using MarvelApp
  • Extreme attention to detail
  • Front-end experience with HTML, CSS / Sass, JavaScript (Vue.js / React) a strong plus, though not required
  • A portfolio that demonstrates the ability to design complex workflows and data heavy applications
  • Comfort with writing clear, concise UI copy

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Are hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k Plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

Product Designer at Motel

Remote

Motel is looking to add an experienced, US-based Product Designer to our remote team!

Motel is a fully remote, US-based digital product agency. We have a few strongly held convictions:

We take care of each other

We believe strongly that companies should take care of their employees, and that employees should take care of each other. We provide weekly mentorship to help guide you down a career framework you’ll help us craft, a transparent and competitive compensation package, and generous benefits.

Do great work, and then do something else

We ask a lot of our team, but we also know that your job is only part of your life. We’ll keep you busy during ‘working hours’ but leave you plenty of time to pursue the things that are important to you outside of your job. We are committed to a 40 hour work week.

Great products are crafted by integrated teams

We believe that great products are created through the close collaboration of design and engineering. Our engineering team plays a big part in our design process, and our design team collaborates closely with the engineering team at all stages of the development process.

We are looking for a Product Designer to join our nimble team of collaborative, driven engineers and designers at Motel to help us create beautiful digital products and marketing materials.

Motel’s Design Team:

  • Leads clients through every phase of the design process, from initial research and visual identity, all the way through product design.
  • Uses their familiarity with web and engineering limitations to design proactively, and routinely contributes in engineering-focused meetings.
  • Has the vocabulary and articulation to explain concepts to folks with and without backgrounds in design.
  • Pays special attention to creating designs that are accessible and usable by everyone.
  • Can both create within clients’ existing brand guidelines, and/or create a comprehensive new style guide and visual identity guidelines.
  • Creates robust styles guides, including well-organized, build-ready assets.
  • Communicates skillfully with teammates and clients, who have a wide variety of design knowledge.
  • Uses rapid prototyping and animation to express design concepts.
  • Spends most of their day completing projects in Sketch, Adobe Suite, Principle, and InVision.
  • Is passionate about personal growth as well as helping improve the quality of work across the team.
  • Cultivates an environment of healthy communication, support, and collaboration.

If you check most or all of these boxes we would love to consider you for this position. Most qualified applicants will have 2 to 4 years of professional digital design experience and have worked successfully on a remote team before.

Salary and Benefits

The starting salary for this position will be between $69,000 and $83,000 annually.

As for benefits, we offer many!

  • The cost of your health insurance is 100% covered by Motel. You may also add your family to your plan, and we’ll cover 50% of their cost too.
  • The cost of vision and dental insurance is 100% covered by Motel for both you and your family.
  • We are proud to offer twelve weeks of paid parental leave any time you add a new member to your family.
  • We will give you a company card that is loaded with $300 every month to cover work-related expenses, such as a coworking space membership, home internet, coffee, and so on.
  • We go on team-wide retreats about every nine months and we can’t wait for you to come along. We’ll explore a new city together and bond IRL.
  • Every year we’ll give you $2,000 to spend attending industry-relevent conferences or classes.
  • Our team works on a flexible schedule with very few meetings. You can get your work done each day at the time that works best for you.
  • We enjoy each other’s company but realized we don’t get nearly enough of it. We’ll give you a Buddy Budget with $1,000 to spend every year traveling with your coworkers.

Motel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity of background, age, story, and complimentary skill sets are what make teams successful. We are committed to making hiring decisions with that in mind and we provide everyone with equal access to professional development.

Please note that we are unable to offer work visa sponsorship at this time.

You will be responsible for understanding and designing new features and improvements as part of a small feature team. You will ensure the solution satisfies the initial problem statement, is technically viable, and integrates well with existing design patterns (or adds new ones where necessary).

You’ll be working with Craig (best axe thrower in the company), Ben (not the best axe thrower in the company), and Anthony on a daily basis and often with the engineering team throughout the design process.

At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.

We’re building a world-class team to revolutionize language learning with cutting-edge technology and beautiful design.

What we’re working on at Slang:

Slang started at MIT as a research project on using AI and NLP to make learning a new language as efficient as possible. Our technology powers a highly adaptive e-learning platform that offers an unprecedented variety of specialized English courses and proficiency tests for career development in over fifty fields like Sales, Finance, Logistics, Medicine, and Law. With just a small team, we’ve already created the largest professional English offering in the world. Now, we’re scaling up to release 1,000 more courses over the next three years.

What this role is about:

In this role, you’ll be involved in the experience and visual design of new product features across our web and mobile applications. You’ll be our first full-time designer, handling both UI and UX design and maintaining our visual brand across everything from our applications to our print materials. We have tens of thousands of active users and many subproblems in language learning to tackle.

We have a diverse set of users, including learners who use Slang’s web and mobile apps to learn a language, managers who use the Slang management app to help their employees or students succeed, and internal Slang employees who use the Slang administrative app to build content and manage clients. Each of these applications has unique requirements around simplicity and data density, and each presents interesting design opportunities.

As a company, we have a strong appreciation for aesthetics and the impact of visual design on user experience.

Some interesting problems we’re tackling:

  • How can we design the learning experience to communicate the power of the advanced data-science deciding the particular sequence of activities a user sees while maintaining simplicity and intuitiveness?
  • How can we communicate language-learning progress to our users? How can we aggregate and communicate the learning statistics of a company’s employees for display to their managers?
  • How can we design the data-dense internal interfaces used for content development for maximum throughput?

What Slang can offer you:

Our compensation package includes a competitive salary, company equity, and unique benefits.

Most importantly, we offer the special experience of being part of a fast-moving and quickly growing international company within the entrepreneurial ecosystems of Boston and MIT.

For more information about Slang and our ecosystem, check out our El Tiempo interview from our beta launch; the portfolio of Social Capital, our lead investor and investor in companies like Slack and Intercom; our Crunchbase profile; and the profiles of our founders, Diego Villegas and Kamran Khan.

Where we’re located:

Our team is currently split between Boston and Bogotá, and we are recruiting great people in these locations and around the world who are able to work remotely. This role provides an opportunity to travel to our current offices in Boston and Bogotá and the new offices we’ll be opening this year!

Our US headquarters is located in the Cambridge Innovation Center in the heart of downtown Boston, easily accessible by public transportation and alongside other innovative companies. Our Colombia office is located in the Rosales neighborhood of Bogotá.

Exodus UI/UX Designers start between 45k - 85k+ USD based on experience. All salaries are paid in Bitcoin. Although we understand everyone will not fit everything in the categories below, and some designers may be more technical with code while others may be more UI-focused with design, these are some general salary guidelines for this position based on your background and expertise.

45k :

You know your way around design tools like Sketch, Photoshop, Flinto, After Effects, Zeplin and Illustrator. You can take previously finished concepts and spin off iterations for marketing campaigns. How to Apply

To apply for this position, please submit a cover letter, resume and salary requirements. Please include in your cover letter how you heard about this position.

About American Coatings Association

ACA is a voluntary, nonprofit organization working to advance the needs of the paint and coatings industry and the professionals who work in it. Through advocacy of the industry and its positions on legislative, regulatory, and judicial issues at the federal, state and local levels, it acts as an effective ally ensuring that the industry is represented and fairly considered. The association focuses on advancements in science and technology through its technical conferences and journals, and offers essential business information to members through its publications, surveys, and business programs.

About PaintCare

PaintCare, a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, was established by the American Coatings Association (ACA) to implement state-mandated paint stewardship programs on behalf of paint manufacturers in each state that adopts a paint stewardship law. Funding for PaintCare is provided through a fee on new paint sales. Funding is used to establish drop-off sites where the public can take leftover paint for recycling, pay for the recycling of this paint, and provide public education and program administration. Oregon passed the first industry-supported paint stewardship law in 2009. PaintCare states now include California, Colorado, Connecticut, Maine, Minnesota, Oregon, Rhode Island, and Vermont. Please visit www.paintcare.org for more information.

PaintCare’s headquarters is located in Washington, DC. Corporate staff members are located at the DC office, while most program staff are located in the states with paint stewardship programs. This position is located at the Washington, DC office.
